problem_text:
Does there exist an absolute constant k such that for any prefrattini subgroup H in any finite soluble group G there exist k conjugates of H whose intersection is Φ(G)?
S. F. Kamornikov
answer: Yes, such a constant exists and is equal to 3 (S. F. Kamornikov, Int. J. Group Theory, 6, no. 2 (2017), 1–5).
